title: Shooting Aftermath Leaves Homeland Security Department in Turmoil
summary: As officials point fingers in the wake of Alex Pretti’s death at the hands of federal agents, concerns grow about the agency’s future.

title: How Battlefield Tech Was Used in Minneapolis
summary: Our reporter Thomas Gibbons-Neff, who deployed twice to Afghanistan as a Marine and later was our Kabul bureau chief, looks at the battlefield technology used for an immigration arrest at a home in Minneapolis.

title: Trump and Schumer Move Toward Possible Deal to Avert a Shutdown
summary: The president and the top Senate Democrat were discussing an agreement to split off homeland security funding from a broader spending package and negotiate new limits on immigration agents.

title: For Minneapolis’s Native Americans, a New Fight Echoes a Bitter History
summary: The crackdown on unauthorized immigrants is resonating deeply among the Dakota and other tribes, as residents confront what they call a federal occupation of their land.

title: At World’s Busiest Port, China’s Unbalanced Economy Comes Into View
summary: The shipping traffic and factories never stop in China’s port city of Ningbo, but the local housing market has crashed and nearby restaurants sit empty.

title: Trump’s Trade Policies Sort Manufacturers Into Winners and Losers
summary: Tariffs have protected some companies, but more often they’ve hit the parts and materials many factories need to make finished goods.

title: U.K.’s Starmer Meets Xi Jinping in Beijing as Ties Warm
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer of Britain is seeking to promote economic ties for growth, offering China’s leader, Xi Jinping, a way to court one of America’s allies.

title: A Rug Maker Withstood One Year of Trump’s Tariffs. New Challenges Loom.
summary: Loloi stockpiled rugs from India, Turkey and other countries in advance, but inventory is running low.

title: What We Learned After Tracking Every Lawsuit Challenging Trump’s Policies
summary: President Trump’s agenda faced more than 600 lawsuits over the past year. In many cases, district court judges found his policies to be unlawful.

title: F.B.I. Agents Search Georgia Election Center
summary: F.B.I. agents searched a Fulton County, Ga., election center for ballots from 2020, escalating an investigation of a heavily Democratic jurisdiction the president has criticized over his defeat.

title: Another Top Kennedy Center Official Resigns
summary: Kevin Couch, who was announced as senior vice president of artistic programming less than two weeks ago, is the latest to leave since President Trump took control of the center last year.

title: Rubio Says Venezuela Will Submit Monthly Budget to White House
summary: Democrats sharply questioned the plan, including the role of Qatar in managing an account funded by the sale of Venezuelan oil.

title: The Shakers’ Utopian World Sees a Surge of Modern Interest
summary: A show at ICA Philadelphia joins a surge of Shaker-inspired projects: films, dances, a museum’s expansion. Refracted through new interpreters, Shaker culture bends, and twists.

title: The Journey of a Group of Cuban Deportees Stuck at Guantánamo
summary: The tale illustrates how inefficient the ICE operation has been in the year since President Trump ordered the base to prepare for up to 30,000 “criminal aliens.”

title: Maxim Naumov to Skate at 2026 Olympics After Parents’ Death in D.C. Plane Crash
summary: After his parents died in the midair collision over Washington, D.C., a year ago, Maxim Naumov struggled to put on his skates. Now he will compete for the United States at the Milan-Cortina Games.

title: Netanyahu Vows to Cut Israel’s Reliance on U.S. Military Aid
summary: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu blamed some soldiers’ deaths in the Gaza war on a lack of ammunition caused by a pause in American weapon deliveries during President Biden’s term.

title: 3 Things to Know About the Next Winter Storm
summary: It’s not likely to be as widespread as the last storm, but it could be unwelcome to people still facing piles of snow. Here’s what we know so far.

title: Why Some Cold States Are Making It Cheaper to Run a Heat Pump
summary: New discounts can make heat pumps go from a bad investment to a good idea.

title: TPS Expiration Under Trump Hits Haitian Workers in Critical Health Care Roles
summary: Haitians are a vital source of employees for health care providers in many communities. The Trump administration is removing legal status next month for 330,000 of them.

title: How His Duel With Trump Boosted Emmanuel Macron, France’s Embattled President
summary: Dismissed as a lame duck, Emmanuel Macron has clawed back some influence after his defense of Greenland and Denmark. Will quieter domestic politics allow him to secure his legacy?

title: Amy Klobuchar Announces Run for Minnesota Governor
summary: The Democratic senator, who signaled her bid after Gov. Tim Walz said he wouldn’t run again, talked about moving past political divides in a video announcement.

title: A State Senate Race in Texas Offers Republicans a Warning
summary: A State Senate runoff on Saturday in the Fort Worth suburbs will preview whether a backlash against conservative social policies will give Democrats a chance to gain.

title: Senator Tina Smith: My State Showed Courage. Will Republicans?
summary: Minnesotans have stood up for common decency and our founding principles.

title: A ‘Fringe Epidemiologist’ on What’s Wrong With Public Health
summary: Jay Bhattacharya, the N.I.H. director, says authorities broke the public’s trust in the Covid era. Now it’s up to outsiders to restore it.

title: A Crisis for President Trump
summary: The Department of Homeland Security is in turmoil after the killing of Alex Pretti.

title: Late Night Praises Ilhan Omar’s Quick Reflexes
summary: Stephen Colbert said the Minneapolis congresswoman looked “ready to throw some hands” after a man sprayed a substance at her at a town hall.

title: Driver Rams Car Into Headquarters of Chabad Hasidic Movemen
summary: No one was injured when the motorist drove into a rear door of the building on Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn. The man was arrested; the police are investigating the incident as a hate crime.

title: Shirley Raines, Who Gave L.A.’s Homeless Food and Makeovers, Is Dead
summary: Her work feeding people and dyeing their hair through her Los Angeles nonprofit, Beauty 2 the Streetz, was known to millions online.

title: She Couldn’t Defend Herself, but He Wasn’t Charged With Rape
summary: A decision in China not to charge a man who fathered children with a woman with a mental illness has set off a debate about consent and the state’s push for babies.
